intro: Galium kunmingense, commonly known as the Kunming bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. Galium kunmingense is often used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
